protocol_name: Genomic DNA extraction from the pennate diatom Asterionella formosa optimised for next generation sequencing.
protocol_name_html: Genomic DNA extraction from the pennate diatom Asterionella formosa optimised for next generation sequencing.
description:
Asterionella formosa is a freshwater pennate diatom that forms star-shaped colonies, whose mitochondrial DNA was recently sequenced [1]. This diatom is of interest for genetic studies [2,3] and for the study of photosynthesis [4,5]. However, extraction of genomic DNA (gDNA) from A. formosa is difficult because of its silica cell-wall and the presence of photosynthetic pigments that contaminate the DNA. Here, we present an optimised protocol for gDNA extraction from A. formosa that overcomes those two problems. We also assessed its efficacity in yielding high-purity gDNA compared to a standard protocol using hexadecyltrimethylammonium bromide (CTAB).

 

References

[1] Villain A. et al. (2017) Mitochondr. DNA. 2 (1), 97-98.

[2] De Bruin A. et al. (2004) J. Phycol. 40, 823-830.

[3] van Den Wyngaert S. et al. (2015) Mol. Ecol. 24, 2955-2972.

[4] Boggetto N. et al. (2007) J. Phycol. 43, 1227-1235.

[5] Erales J. et al. (2008) J. Phycol. 44, 1455-1464.
warning: Some of the reageants used (e.g. β-mercaptoethanol, chloroform) are toxic and, as such, require careful handling, appropriate safety gear and the use of a chemical fume hood.
protocol_affiliation: Aix Marseille Univ CNRS, BIP,Imperial College of London

groups.group_name: MinION user group for high molecular weight DNA extraction from all kingdoms

status_info: This protocol used in our group is working very well for a freshwater diatom and could be extended to other diatoms (it works with a marine diatom).

components.data: Preparation of the hexadecyltrimethylammonium bromide (CTAB) buffer
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Preparation of the hexadecyltrimethylammonium bromide (CTAB) buffer

components.data: Prepare 10% CTAB (hexadecyltrimethylammonium bromide) solution by dissolving it in DNase- and RNase-free (molecular grade) water.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare 10% CTAB (hexadecyltrimethylammonium bromide) solution by dissolving it in DNase- and RNase-free (molecular grade) water.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of Genomic DNA extraction from the pennate diatom Asterionella formosa optimised for next generation sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name: Genomic DNA extraction from the pennate diatom Asterionella formosa optimised for next generation sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name_html: Genomic DNA extraction from the pennate diatom Asterionella formosa optimised for next generation sequencing.
source_data.annotation: Slowly add the powder and microwave until complete dissolution. Keep the solution at 37°c to avoid precipitation.
source_data.thread_text: Slowly add the powder and microwave until complete dissolution. Keep the solution at 37°c to avoid precipitation.
source_data.body: Slowly add the powder and microwave until complete dissolution. Keep the solution at 37°c to avoid precipitation.

components.data: Solutions to prepare in advance
components.name: Section

components.data:
Prepare the following solutions:

  • 1 M Tris-HCl at pH 8.0.
  • 0.5 M EDTA at pH 8.0.
  • 5 M NaCl.
  • 7.5 M Ammonium acetate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare the following solutions:

  • 1 M Tris-HCl at pH 8.0.
  • 0.5 M EDTA at pH 8.0.
  • 5 M NaCl.
  • 7.5 M Ammonium acetate.

components.data: Before starting
components.name: Section

components.data: Heat up a water bath to 65°C and another one to 37°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Heat up a water bath to 65°C and another one to 37°C.

components.data:
Right before use, make the buffer by mixing together:

  • 3 ml of 10% CTAB solution (final concentration of 3%).
  • 2.8 ml of 5 M NaCL (final concentration of 28%).
  • 0.4 ml of 5 M EDTA (final concentration of 4%).
  • 1 ml of Tris-HCl at pH 8.0 (final concentration of 10%).
  • 2.78 ml of molecular-grade, DNase- and RNase-free water.
  • 0.02 ml of β-mercaptoethanol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Right before use, make the buffer by mixing together:

  • 3 ml of 10% CTAB solution (final concentration of 3%).
  • 2.8 ml of 5 M NaCL (final concentration of 28%).
  • 0.4 ml of 5 M EDTA (final concentration of 4%).
  • 1 ml of Tris-HCl at pH 8.0 (final concentration of 10%).
  • 2.78 ml of molecular-grade, DNase- and RNase-free water.
  • 0.02 ml of β-mercaptoethanol.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 3 of Genomic DNA extraction from the pennate diatom Asterionella formosa optimised for next generation sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name: Genomic DNA extraction from the pennate diatom Asterionella formosa optimised for next generation sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name_html: Genomic DNA extraction from the pennate diatom Asterionella formosa optimised for next generation sequencing.
source_data.annotation: The CTAB buffer should be made shortly before use, as it is unstable, especially after addition of β-mercaptoethanol.
source_data.thread_text: The CTAB buffer should be made shortly before use, as it is unstable, especially after addition of β-mercaptoethanol.
source_data.body: The CTAB buffer should be made shortly before use, as it is unstable, especially after addition of β-mercaptoethanol.
β-mercaptoethanol should be handled in a chemical fume hood and with the appropriate safety gear.

components.data: Keep 100% isopropanol at -20°C and the 7.5 M ammonium acetate solution at 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Keep 100% isopropanol at -20°C and the 7.5 M ammonium acetate solution at 4°C.

components.data: Pre-heat the CTAB buffer to 65°C in order to prevent precipitation and to ensure better protein denaturation.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pre-heat the CTAB buffer to 65°C in order to prevent precipitation and to ensure better protein denaturation.

components.data: Extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Harvest 90 mg of Asterionella formosa cells by centrifuging 250 ml of  culture in stationary phase (OD ~0.1).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Harvest 90 mg of Asterionella formosa cells by centrifuging 250 ml of  culture in stationary phase (OD ~0.1).

components.data: Re-suspend the cells in 1.5 ml of freshly-made, pre-heated CTAB buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Re-suspend the cells in 1.5 ml of freshly-made, pre-heated CTAB buffer.

components.data: Keep at 65°C for 1 hour.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Keep at 65°C for 1 hour.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 9 of Genomic DNA extraction from the pennate diatom Asterionella formosa optimised for next generation sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name: Genomic DNA extraction from the pennate diatom Asterionella formosa optimised for next generation sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name_html: Genomic DNA extraction from the pennate diatom Asterionella formosa optimised for next generation sequencing.
source_data.annotation: The sample can stay in the hot water bath (at 65°C) for several hours, if necessary.
source_data.thread_text: The sample can stay in the hot water bath (at 65°C) for several hours, if necessary.
source_data.body: The sample can stay in the hot water bath (at 65°C) for several hours, if necessary.

components.data: Centrifuge the sample in order to collect all the liquid that may have stuck to the wall of the tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the sample in order to collect all the liquid that may have stuck to the wall of the tube.

components.data: Split the sample into 3 aliquots of 500 µl, each in a DNase- and RNase-free 1.5 ml eppendorf tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Split the sample into 3 aliquots of 500 µl, each in a DNase- and RNase-free 1.5 ml eppendorf tube.

components.data: Add 500 µl of chloroform:isoamyl alcohol (24:1) solution to each tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 500 µl of chloroform:isoamyl alcohol (24:1) solution to each tube.

source_data.body: The chloroform:isoamyl alcohol (24:1) solution should be handled in a chemical fume hood and with the appropriate safety gear.

components.data: Mix by inversion for 5 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix by inversion for 5 min.

components.data: Centrifuge for 10 min at 11,000 x g at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge for 10 min at 11,000 x g at room temperature.

components.data: Pipette the upper (aqueous) phase with a seringe and put 500µL of the phase in each tubes
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipette the upper (aqueous) phase with a seringe and put 500µL of the phase in each tubes

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 15 of Genomic DNA extraction from the pennate diatom Asterionella formosa optimised for next generation sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name: Genomic DNA extraction from the pennate diatom Asterionella formosa optimised for next generation sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name_html: Genomic DNA extraction from the pennate diatom Asterionella formosa optimised for next generation sequencing.
source_data.annotation: This first precipitation step allows to separate the nucleic acids (in the aqueous phase) from the cells' pigments and hydrophobic components (in the organic phase) and the denatured proteins (at the interface between the two phases).
source_data.thread_text: This first precipitation step allows to separate the nucleic acids (in the aqueous phase) from the cells' pigments and hydrophobic components (in the organic phase) and the denatured proteins (at the interface between the two phases).
source_data.body: This first precipitation step allows to separate the nucleic acids (in the aqueous phase) from the cells' pigments and hydrophobic components (in the organic phase) and the denatured proteins (at the interface between the two phases).

components.data: Add 8 µl of RNase (4mg/mL), mix thouroughly by pipetting up and down.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 8 µl of RNase (4mg/mL), mix thouroughly by pipetting up and down.

components.data: Split each tube in 250 µl aliquots, in order to maximise thermal exchanges and thus RNase digestion.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Split each tube in 250 µl aliquots, in order to maximise thermal exchanges and thus RNase digestion.

components.data: Keep at 37°C for one hour.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Keep at 37°C for one hour.

components.data: Add 500 µl of chloroform:isoamyl alcohol (24:1) solution to suppress RNase activity.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 500 µl of chloroform:isoamyl alcohol (24:1) solution to suppress RNase activity.

components.data: Pour the aliquots back together in order to reach a final volume of 500 µl.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pour the aliquots back together in order to reach a final volume of 500 µl.

components.data: Transfer the upper (aqueous) phase with a syringe into an eppendorf tube. Combine the aqueous phase from each tube as much as possible, but without exceeding a volume of 750 µl per eppendorf tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the upper (aqueous) phase with a syringe into an eppendorf tube. Combine the aqueous phase from each tube as much as possible, but without exceeding a volume of 750 µl per eppendorf tube.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 21 of Genomic DNA extraction from the pennate diatom Asterionella formosa optimised for next generation sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name: Genomic DNA extraction from the pennate diatom Asterionella formosa optimised for next generation sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name_html: Genomic DNA extraction from the pennate diatom Asterionella formosa optimised for next generation sequencing.
source_data.annotation: Combining the aqueous phases from each sample serves to concentrate the extracted genomic DNA (gDNA).
source_data.thread_text: Combining the aqueous phases from each sample serves to concentrate the extracted genomic DNA (gDNA).
source_data.body: Combining the aqueous phases from each sample serves to concentrate the extracted genomic DNA (gDNA).

components.data: DNA precipitation
components.name: Section

components.data: Measure the volume of the liquid obtained from the previous step.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Measure the volume of the liquid obtained from the previous step.

components.data: Add the same volume of cold 100% isopropanol (kept at -20°C) as the volume measured two steps earlier.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add the same volume of cold 100% isopropanol (kept at -20°C) as the volume measured two steps earlier.

components.data: Add a volume of cold 7.5 M ammonium acetate that is equivalent to 8% of the volume measured in the previous step.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add a volume of cold 7.5 M ammonium acetate that is equivalent to 8% of the volume measured in the previous step.

components.data: Mix thoroughly by inversion.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix thoroughly by inversion.

components.data: Keep in the freezer for 30 minutes to 1 hour.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Keep in the freezer for 30 minutes to 1 hour.

components.data: Centrifuge at x 11,000g at 4°C for 10 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at x 11,000g at 4°C for 10 min.

components.data: Carefully discard the supernatant without touching the pellet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully discard the supernatant without touching the pellet.

components.data: Add 700 µl of 70% ethanol without re-suspending the pellet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 700 µl of 70% ethanol without re-suspending the pellet.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 29 of Genomic DNA extraction from the pennate diatom Asterionella formosa optimised for next generation sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name: Genomic DNA extraction from the pennate diatom Asterionella formosa optimised for next generation sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name_html: Genomic DNA extraction from the pennate diatom Asterionella formosa optimised for next generation sequencing.
source_data.annotation: The point of this step is to wash the pellet.
source_data.thread_text: The point of this step is to wash the pellet.
source_data.body: The point of this step is to wash the pellet.

components.data: Invert the tube 5-10 times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Invert the tube 5-10 times.

components.data: Centrifuge at 11,000 g at room temperature for 3 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at 11,000 g at room temperature for 3 min.

components.data: Discard the supernatant (without touching the pellet).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard the supernatant (without touching the pellet).

components.data: Wash the supernatant as previously: add 700 µl of 100% ethanol (without re-suspending the pellet), then invert the tube 5-10 times and centrifuge at 11, 000 g at room temperature for 3 min before finally discarding the supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the supernatant as previously: add 700 µl of 100% ethanol (without re-suspending the pellet), then invert the tube 5-10 times and centrifuge at 11, 000 g at room temperature for 3 min before finally discarding the supernatant.

components.data: Let the DNA dry in chemical flow hood, bearing in mind that it can be a very fast process.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Let the DNA dry in chemical flow hood, bearing in mind that it can be a very fast process.

components.data: Re-hydrate the DNA with 30-50 µl of molecular-grade water (the exact volume depending on the size of the pellet).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Re-hydrate the DNA with 30-50 µl of molecular-grade water (the exact volume depending on the size of the pellet).

components.data: Keep the tube overnight at 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Keep the tube overnight at 4°C.

components.data: Assessing the extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: The following day, re-suspend the DNA and homogenise the solution by pipetting up and down.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The following day, re-suspend the DNA and homogenise the solution by pipetting up and down.

components.data: Measure the quantity of DNA e.g. with a nanodrop instrument.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Measure the quantity of DNA e.g. with a nanodrop instrument.

components.data: Run a 1% agarose gel at 100 V for 20 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run a 1% agarose gel at 100 V for 20 min.

components.data: Array
components.name: Expected result

components.data:
To assess the efficiency of this protocol compared to the standard CTAB protocol by Promega, we have performed the extraction of gDNA from Asterionella formosa using both protocols. The results are shown below:

 

  Standard CTAB protocol Optimised protocol
Absorption spectrum
A260:A280 ratio 1.92

1.98
A260:A230 ratio 0.8 2.14
Gel A unique band is present, no smear, no band near 200pb (contamination by RNA)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
To assess the efficiency of this protocol compared to the standard CTAB protocol by Promega, we have performed the extraction of gDNA from Asterionella formosa using both protocols. The results are shown below:

 

  Standard CTAB protocol Optimised protocol
Absorption spectrum
A260:A280 ratio 1.92

1.98
A260:A230 ratio 0.8 2.14
Gel A unique band is present, no smear, no band near 200pb (contamination by RNA)

components.data: Comparison with standard CTAB protocol
components.name: Section

components.data: Mix by inversion for 5 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix by inversion for 5 min.

components.data: Centrifuge for 10 min at 11,000 x g at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge for 10 min at 11,000 x g at room temperature.

components.name: Description
